text:
#Gen4IsBest

Change my mind
author: Brenton Taylor

text: This is one of my personal favorites!
author: M S

text: So much nostalgia of booting Soul silver up for the first time, then playing platinum, just, God dang I love Sinnoh to death, best of the regions and generations of Pokemon.
author: JimGio

text: Hahah there are some notes at the begining that remind me of Sowing the seeds of love (though I recognize they are not the same)
author: Carlos Pozo

text: Awesome Song! It gives me the sense of adventure.
author: VGMusicMachine

text:
Don't think of heard this from Brawl. Awesome sauce. =)

Thinking back on the D/P/Plat, Gen4 was the generation I came back into pokemon, so this song brings back all kinds of great memories. Thanks for the upload Supra! ^_^
author: Aquajolt

text: So, so good. This was my absolute favorite song playing on the stage.
author: GatlingSmash

text: This is an amazing piece a music.  Never expected this from smash.
author: HyMyNameIsMatt

text: I could leave this song playing while sleeping and have pleasant dreams all night long.
author: Peter Martinez

text: This theme is adventure
author: Hans-Jeiger Gram

text: Yes!
author: Hyper Yoshi 21

text: nice. reminds me of an ELO song or something, damn what is it..
author: downhillracers

text: I think it's "Telephone Line."  Those first few notes are extremely similar.
author: Top Gun

text: that's it. also similar to "all the young dudes" by david bowie/mott the hoople
author: downhillracers

text: Not really a song for fighting, but still lovely. One of the few memorable route themes in that game in my opinion. Platinum still is my most played Pokémon game. I think I stopped playing it at 649 hours. It was my first game where I started playing multiplayer and paying attention to natures, IVs, all that stuff. So yeah, this is pretty nostalgic.
author: GreatSpaceToaster

text: Dude that's the same boat I'm in!
author: chenmaster2

text:
"One, 21 Guns
Lay down your arms
Give up the fight..."

I dunno. The first part of this song in D/P/Pt and Brawl reminded me of that Green Day song...
author: myohel0

text: You're not the only one :P
author: Raining Wolfs

text: I liked this song too but I just realized how it reminds me of one of those educational videos they would show in the 90s. XD
author: streetough

text: I like this track, but I think I prefer the original Diamond and Pearl version.
author: Callum Donovan

text: Probably my favourite of the Pokemon arrangements in Brawl.
author: Medal Melodies

text: nice
author: Lunolux

text: I really liked the original theme, the SSBB remix sounds as good IMO, it just feels like a modern version of the old song to me. When I think about it, it's a bit surprising this is just the second SSBB entry on this list, I really love some of the remixes from this game.
author: Julian

text: Sounds like a good theme for a soap opera, or one of those more down to earth British sitcoms.
author: Matrilwood

text: elchh
author: Kakashi Hatake

text: If you think British Sitcoms are down to earth, you have not seen our Sitcoms.
author: Dan Buck

text:
@Dan Buck
I was referring specifically to the ones that were down to earth like "As Time Goes By", which is why I specifically said "Down to earth sitcoms" specifically.
author: Matrilwood

text: @Matrilwood I'm British and never heard of that programme. After looking it up, yeah it looks shite. But I get what you mean though.
author: ribena

text: @Markell1991 It's an old people's show XD
author: Matrilwood

text: It looks like a good show to me
author: roermy

text: We don't use the term 'sitcom'.
author: Acrophis

text: @Acrophis Ok, who the fuck is "We" and why should I care what words you do and don't use?
author: Matrilwood

text: Are you frustrated?
author: Acrophis

text: This is such a weird song for a fighting game, but still great nevertheless.
author: Tyler Hubbs

text: It suits it perfectly in my opinion, it may sound weird just by hearing but when you hear it while you're playing smash, you'd be surprised how well it fits the action.
author: RoronoaVante

text: supersmashbros.. awesome :) full of epic music aswell, best crossover ever
author: EricIkkie

text: The beginning sounds like a song by The Beatles or someone, it sounds familiar. I love pokemon though so I got no gripes.
author: Mr Mevik

text: Absolutely, I was going to comment on that but I wasn't sure if it was just me. It's also the reason why this somehow reminds me of something you could hear in Mother 1 or Earthbound, since the music from those games were heavily inspired by artists like the Beatles. Funny coincidence that Shogo Sakai who arranged this was Mother 3's composer too!
author: SupraDarky

text: Haha! I didn't know that, thanks for telling me! Gonna track down that song though. :P
author: Mr Mevik

text: I think it's Strawberry Fields Forever.
author: GreatSpaceToaster

text: @stuwee3 I don't know, I think that part at 3 seconds sounds a bit like a part on that song. Then again, I haven't listened to it in quite a while, so you may very well be right.
author: GreatSpaceToaster

text: @stuwee3 21 Guns
author: GameBeatenakaKevinS

text: This game's soundtrack is like 12 hours, hard to pick one song. Glad they remixed one of my favorite songs from Diamond (that middle school nostalgia, man.) nice upload. I'm extremely excited for the next entry, I've been brushing up on my Melee skills. My hype cannot be contained.
author: lacoot

text: Pleasant arrangement of Route 209 originally from Pokemon Diamond/Pearl/Platinum. I'm far from the biggest Smash fan so I can't say I'm super excited for the next entry, but I do like to keep an eye on the new challengers that are being announced every other month. Mega Man being in it was the highlight so far. I do expect to buy it though, it's always a good time when inviting friends over!
author: SupraDarky

text: @***** Megaman X would have been so cool in Smash...
author: Alfonso ST

text: Just curious SD but what's your favorite Smash Bros.?  Mine's Melee.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: My favorite thing about Brawl is just how many great songs from various franchises you can access and all of the fantastic remixes there are. I do hope Smash 4 doesn't lack in the sound department!
author: Rocket Ken

text: I wish I was a bigger Nintendo fan (well, even BIGGER than I already am) so that I could appreciate that more.
author: LinkMarioSamus
